com.artisan.powerhooks
Class PowerHookManager

java.lang.Object
  com.artisan.powerhooks.PowerHookManager

public class PowerHookManager
extends java.lang.Object

Manages all Power Hooks used with Artisan. This includes:

  • Registering variables to be set dynamically by Artisan Tools.
  • Referencing these variables in the code.
  • Registering blocks whose arguments can be set dynamically by Artisan Tools.
  • Referencing these blocks in the code.
  • Providing test methods to verify the impact of different hooks on your app code.
Power Hooks are key-value pairs or code blocks with key-value arguments that are passed into your application code by Artisan when your app starts, allowing for settings, text, and logic to be modified on the fly for all user devices without revisioning or updating your application.

PowerHookManager is a singleton that is automatically initialized when your app starts.

All hooks created using PowerHookManager are registered with Artisan Tools automatically when you connect your device to Artisan for the first time. The registration process will detect all registered hook keys, and will display all of the hooks and code blocks for this app in Artisan Tools where they can be edited. Values set on hooks on the web will automatically be downloaded by all devices upon app startup, allowing for their usage throughout your system code.

registerVariable

public static void registerVariable(java.lang.String hookId,
                                    java.lang.String friendlyName,
                                    java.lang.String defaultValue)
Registers a Power Hook Variable for use with Artisan. Use this method to declare the existence of a Power Hook Variable that you would like to pass in from Artisan. This declaration should occur in the registerPowerhooks method of your CustomArtisanService. 
 PowerHookManager.registerVariable("addToCartButton", "Add To Cart Button Text", "Buy Now");

Parameters:
hookId - The name of the variable setting to register. Name must be unique for this app.
friendlyName - The name for this hook that will be displayed in Artisan Tools.
defaultValue - The default value for this hook. This value will be used if no value is passed in from Artisan Tools for this app.

registerBlock

public static void registerBlock(java.lang.String blockId,
                                 java.lang.String friendlyName,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> defaultData,
                                 ArtisanBlock block)
Registers a Power Hook Block for use with Artisan. Use this method to declare the existence of a code block you would like to use in your app with data that is configurable from Artisan. This declaration should occur in the registerPowerhooks method of your CustomArtisanService. 
 @Override
 public void registerPowerhooks() {
        HashMap<String, String> defaultData = new HashMap<String, String>();
        defaultData.put("discountCode", "012345ABC");
        defaultData.put("discountAmount", "25%");
        defaultData.put("shouldDisplay", "true");
        PowerHookManager.registerBlock("showAlert", "Show Alert Block", defaultData, new ArtisanBlock() {
                @Override
                public void execute(Map<String, String> data, Map<String, Object> extraData) {
                        if ("true".equalsIgnoreCase(data.get("shouldDisplay"))) {
                                StringBuilder message = new StringBuilder();
                                if (extraData.get("productName") != null) {
                                        message.append("Buy another ");
                                        message.append(data.get("productName"));
                                        message.append(" for a friend! ");
                                }
                                message.append("Use discount code ");
                                message.append(data.get("discountCode"));
                                message.append(" to get ");
                                message.append(data.get("discountAmount"));
                                message.append(" off your next purchase!");
                                Toast.makeText((Context) extraData.get("context"), message, Toast.LENGTH_LONG).show();
                        }
                }
        });
 }

Parameters:
blockId - The name of the block to register. Name must be unique for this app.
friendlyName - The name for this block that will be displayed in Artisan Tools.
defaultData - The default data for this code block. This should be string keys and values. This data will be used if no data is passed in from Artisan Tools for this code block for this app.

executeBlock

public static void executeBlock(java.lang.String blockId)
Execute a Power Hook Block

Use this method to execute a Power Hook Code Block from Artisan. This will use the values specified in Artisan Tools to execute the block. The default data will be used if none has been specified in Artisan Tools.
For example:

 PowerHookManager.executeBlock("profileLogger");

Note: If you execute this Power Hook Block in your first Activity's onCreate method, before the Artisan Service has a chance to start up, the call may be ignored. The Artisan Service is started up at the time your first activity is created, and should be ready by the time your first activity gets to onResume. For the rest of your application's lifecycle you can assume that Power Hooks will work as expected.

Parameters:
blockId - The name of the code to register. Name must be unique for this app. If no block has been registered with the given id, or if the artisan service has not finished starting up, this will do nothing.

executeBlock

public static void executeBlock(java.lang.String blockId,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> extraData)
Execute a Power Hook Block Use this method to execute a Power Hook Code Block from Artisan. This will use the values specified in Artisan Tools to execute the block plus any additional data that is passed in to this method. The default data will be used if none has been specified in Artisan Tools. For example:

 Map<String, Object> extraData = new HashMap<String, Object>();
 extraData.put("productName", "Artisan Andy Plush Toy");
 extraData.put("context", this);
 PowerHookManager.executeBlock("showAlert", extraData);

Note: If you execute this Power Hook Block in your first Activity's onCreate method, before the Artisan Service has a chance to start up, the call may be ignored. The Artisan Service is started up at the time your first activity is created, and should be ready by the time your first activity gets to onResume. For the rest of your application's lifecycle you can assume that Power Hooks will work as expected.

Parameters:
blockId - The name of the code to register. Name must be unique for this app. If no block has been registered with the given id, or if the Artisan Service has not finished starting up, this will do nothing.
extraData - Additional data to use when executing this block. If you need a context to execute your block, you can pass one in here.

getVariableValue

public static java.lang.String getVariableValue(java.lang.String hookId)
Gets the value of a Power Hook Variable. Use this method to get the value of a Power Hook Variable from Artisan. This will return the value specified in Artisan Tools, or the default value if none has been specified.
For example:
 Button cart_button = (Button) findViewById(R.id.AddToCartButton);
 cart_button.setText(PowerHookManager.getVariableValue("addToCartButton"));

Note: If you request the value for this Power Hook Variable in your first Activity's onCreate method, before the Artisan Service has a chance to start up, you may get a null value in return. The Artisan Service is started up at the time your first activity is created, and should be ready by the time your first activity gets to onResume. For the rest of your application's lifecycle you can assume that Power Hooks will work as expected.

Parameters:
hookId - The name of the Power Hook you wish to retrieve. Will return null if the setting has not been registered, or if called before the Artisan Service is started.

setValueForVariable

public static void setValueForVariable(java.lang.String hookId,
                                       java.lang.String value)
Set the value of a Power Hook Variable manually.

Use this method to manually apply a value to an Artisan Power Hook Variable. The app will behave as if this value has been passed from Artisan Tools, and all calls to getVariableValue for this hookId will return this value.

This method should be called in the registerPowerhooks method of your CustomArtisanService. 

 PowerHookManager.setValueForVariable("addToCartButton", "Ship It!");

Note: This method is intended for local test and QA use only, and should *not* be used within production code.

Parameters:
hookId - The name of the Power Hook Variable whose value you want to set. If the Power Hook has not been registered, this will be ignored.
value - The value you want to specify for this Power Hook Variable.

setDataForBlock

public static void setDataForBlock(java.lang.String blockId,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> data)
Set the current data for a Power Hook Block manually.

Use this method to manually set the data for an Artisan Power Hook Block. The app will behave as if this data has been passed from Artisan Tools, and all calls to executeBlock for this blockId will execute using this data.

This method should be called in the registerPowerhooks method of your CustomArtisanService. 

 Map<String, String> newData = new HashMap<String, String>();
 newData.put("discountCode", "ABC001");
 newData.put("discountAmount", "15%");
 newData.put("shouldDisplay", "false");
 PowerHookManager.setDataForBlock("product offer toast", newData);

Note: This method is intended for local test and QA use only, and should *not* be used within production code.

Parameters:
blockId - The name of the Power Hook Block whose data you want to set. If a Power Hook Block has not been registered with this id, this will be ignored.
data - The data you want to specify for this Power Hook Block.

getAllVariables

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,PowerHookVariable> getAllVariables()
Retrieve all registered Power Hook Variables.

Note: This method is intended for local test and QA use only, and should *not* be used within production code.

Returns:
a map of the registered variables, where the keys are the hookIds and the values are PowerHookVariable objects that holds the friendly name, default value and current value for the Power Hook Variable.

getAllBlocks

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,PowerHookBlock> getAllBlocks()
Retrieve all registered Power Hook Blocks.

Note: This method is intended for local test and QA use only, and should *not* be used within production code.

Returns:
a map of the registered code blocks, where the keys are the blockIds, and the values are PowerHookBlock objects that holds the friendly name, default data and current data for the Power Hook Block.
